00049 static __inline__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00050     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00051     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00052             : "=r" (word)
00053             : "r"  (word));
00054     return word;
00055 }
00056 
00057 static inline unsigned long long arti_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00058                                               unsigned long uld,
00059                                               unsigned long *r) {
00060     /*
00061      * Fixed by Marco Morandini <morandini@aero.polimi.it> to work
00062      * with the -fnostrict-aliasing and -O2 combination using GCC
00063      * 3.x.
00064      */
00065 
00066     unsigned long long qf, rf;
00067     unsigned long tq, rh;
00068     union { unsigned long long ull; unsigned long ul[2]; } p, q;
00069 
00070     p.ull = ull;
00071     q.ull = 0;
00072     rf = 0x100000000ULL - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFFUL / uld) * uld;
00073 
00074     while (p.ull >= uld) {
00075         q.ul[1] += (tq = p.ul[1] / uld);
00076         rh = p.ul[1] - tq * uld;
00077         q.ull  += rh * qf + (tq = p.ul[0] / uld);
00078         p.ull   = rh * rf + (p.ul[0] - tq * uld);
00079     }
00080 
00081     *r = p.ull;
00082 
00083     return q.ull;
00084 }
00085 
00086 static inline int arti_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00087 
00088     /* Returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00089     
00090     int dummy;
00091 
00092     __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
00093         "mull %%edx\t\n" \
00094         "div %%ecx\t\n" \
00095         : "=a" (i), "=d" (dummy)
00096         : "a" (i), "d" (mult), "c" (div));
00097 
00098     return i;
00099 }
00100 
00101 static inline long long arti_llimd(long long ll, int mult, int div) {
00102 
00103     /* Returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00104 
00105     __asm__ __volatile ( \
00106         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00107         "mull %%esi\t\n" \
00108         "movl %%eax,%%ebx\n\t" \
00109         "movl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00110         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00111         "mull %%esi\n\t" \
00112         "addl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00113         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00114         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00115         "movl %%eax,%%ecx\t\n" \
00116         "movl %%ebx,%%eax\t\n" \
00117         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00118         "sal $1,%%edx\t\n" \
00119         "cmpl %%edx,%%edi\t\n" \
00120         "movl %%ecx,%%edx\n\t" \
00121         "jge 1f\t\n" \
00122         "addl $1,%%eax\t\n" \
00123         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00124         "1:\t\n" \
00125         : "=A" (ll) \
00126         : "A" (ll), "S" (mult), "D" (div) \
00127         : "%ebx", "%ecx");
00128 
00129     return ll;
00130 }

00203 static inline unsigned long long arti_rdtsc (void) {
00204     unsigned long long t;
00205     __asm__ __volatile__( "rdtsc" : "=A" (t));
00206     return t;
00207 }

00258 /* arti_get_current() is Adeos-specific. Since real-time interrupt
00259    handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI domain stack, we cannot
00260    infere the "current" Linux task address using %esp. We must use the
00261    suspended Linux domain's stack pointer instead. */
00262 
00263 static inline struct task_struct *arti_get_current (int cpuid)
00264 
00265 {
00266     int *esp;
00267 
00268     __asm__ volatile("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r" (esp));
00269 
00270     if (esp >= arti_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < arti_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00271         return (struct task_struct *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL));
00272 
00273     return get_current();
00274 }

00279 static inline void rt_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00280 
00281     arti_cli();
00282     rt_spin_lock(lock);
00283 }
00284 
00285 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00286 
00287     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00288     arti_sti();
00289 }

00291 static inline unsigned long rt_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00292 
00293     unsigned long flags;
00294     arti_local_irq_save(flags);
00295     rt_spin_lock(lock);
00296     return flags;
00297 }

00299 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00300                                              spinlock_t *lock) {
00301     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00302     arti_local_irq_restore(flags);

00305 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00306 
00307 #define CPU_RELAX(x) \
00308 do { \
00309    int i = 0; \
00310    do \
00311      cpu_relax(); \
00312    while (++i < x); \
00313 } while(0)
00314 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00315 #define CPU_RELAX(x)
00316 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00322 static inline void rt_get_global_lock(void) {
00323 
00324     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00325 
00326     arti_cli();
00327 
00328 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00329     adeos_load_cpuid();
00330 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00331 
00332     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock))
00333         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&arti_cpu_lock))
00334             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00335 }
00336 
00337 static inline void rt_release_global_lock(void) {
00338 
00339     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00340 
00341     arti_cli();
00342 
00343 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00344     adeos_load_cpuid();
00345 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00346 
00347     if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock)) {
00348         clear_bit(31,&arti_cpu_lock);
00349         CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00350     }
00351 }
00352 
00365 static inline void rt_global_cli(void) {
00366     rt_get_global_lock();
00367 }
00368 
00375 static inline void rt_global_sti(void) {
00376     rt_release_global_lock();
00377     arti_sti();
00378 }
00379 
00386 static inline int rt_global_save_flags_and_cli(void) {
00387 
00388     unsigned long flags = arti_get_iflag_and_cli();
00389     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00390 
00391 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00392     adeos_load_cpuid();
00393 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00394 
00395     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock))
00396         {
00397         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&arti_cpu_lock))
00398             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00399 
00400         return flags | 1;
00401         }
00402 
00403     return flags;
00404 }
00405 
00413 static inline void rt_global_save_flags(unsigned long *flags) {
00414 
00415     unsigned long hflags = arti_get_iflag_and_cli(), rflags;
00416     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00417 
00418 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00419     adeos_load_cpuid();
00420 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00421 
00422     if (test_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock))
00423         rflags = hflags;
00424     else
00425         rflags = hflags | 1;
00426 
00427     if (hflags)
00428         arti_sti();
00429 
00430     *flags = rflags;
00431 }
00432 
00440 static inline void rt_global_restore_flags(unsigned long flags) {
00441 
00442     switch (flags)
00443         {
00444         case (1 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 1:
00445 
00446             rt_release_global_lock();
00447             arti_sti();
00448             break;
00449 
00450         case (1 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 0:
00451 
00452             rt_get_global_lock();
00453             arti_sti();
00454             break;
00455 
00456         case (0 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 1:
00457 
00458             rt_release_global_lock();
00459             break;
00460 
00461         case (0 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 0:
00462 
00463             rt_get_global_lock();
00464             break;
00465         }
00466 }

00468 static inline void rt_switch_to_real_time(int cpuid) {
00469 
00470     TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_RT(cpuid);
00471     arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask = arti_get_current(cpuid);
00472     arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags = arti_linux_save_flags_and_cli();
00473     set_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_realtime);
00474 }
00475 
00476 static inline void rt_switch_to_linux(int cpuid) {
00477 
00478     TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_LINUX(cpuid);
00479     clear_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_realtime);
00480     arti_linux_restore_flags_nosync(arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags,cpuid);
00481     arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask = NULL;
00482 }
00483 
00484 static inline struct task_struct *rt_whoislinux(int cpuid) {
00485 
00486     return arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask;
00487 }

00489 static inline int rt_is_linux (void) {
00490 
00491     return !test_bit(adeos_processor_id(),&arti_cpu_realtime);
00492 }
00493 
00494 static inline int rt_is_lxrt (void) {
00495 
00496     return test_bit(adeos_processor_id(),&arti_cpu_lxrt);
00497 }

00499 static inline void rt_set_timer_delay (int delay) {
00500 
00501     if (delay) {
00502         unsigned long flags;
00503         arti_hw_lock(flags);
00504 #ifdef __USE_APIC__
00505         apic_read(APIC_TMICT);
00506         apic_write(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00507 #else /* !__USE_APIC__ */
00508         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00509         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00510 #endif /* __USE_APIC__ */
00511         arti_hw_unlock(flags);
00512     }
00513 }
